cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CE. 

The paper deals with machine learning applications involving sequential decision making, which is a common topic in the subfield of reinforcement learning (RL) and sequential decision making. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely category. The paper also discusses the use of submodularity, which is a concept from optimization theory, and proposes a greedy policy, which is a common technique in algorithms and data structures. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) are also likely categories. The paper also mentions experiments on recommendation tasks, which are common in the subfield of information retrieval (IR) and recommender systems. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is another likely category. Finally, the paper discusses the practical utility of the proposed method, which is relevant to the subfield of computer engineering (CE).
